homes_hear_details: Nevada has not yet launched its HOMES or HEAR rebate programs under the Inflation Reduction Act. The Governor's Office of Energy is coordinating with the U.S. Department of Energy on program planning and implementation.

income_thresholds.low_income_80_ami: For Nevada, 80% of Area Median Income varies by county. In Clark County (Las Vegas), 80% AMI for a family of four is approximately $60,100. In Washoe County (Reno), it is approximately $65,500.
income_thresholds.moderate_income_150_ami: For Nevada, 150% of Area Median Income varies by county. In Clark County (Las Vegas), 150% AMI for a family of four is approximately $112,700. In Washoe County (Reno), it is approximately $122,800.

net_metering: Nevada restored net metering in 2017 after a controversial rollback. Under current rules, residential solar customers receive credits at approximately 75% of the retail rate for excess generation, with the rate declining over time as solar adoption increases. Systems up to 1 MW are eligible.

state_tax_credits.name: Nevada Solar Energy Systems Tax Abatement
state_tax_credits.amount: Property tax abatement for solar installations; assessed value of solar equipment is partially exempt from property taxes
state_tax_credits.eligible_items: Solar photovoltaic systems, solar thermal systems installed on residential property
state_tax_credits.details: Nevada provides a property tax exemption for renewable energy systems. The assessed value of qualifying solar energy systems is not included in the property valuation for tax purposes.

state_rebate_programs.name: Home Energy Retrofit Opportunities for Seniors (HEROS)
state_rebate_programs.amount: Up to $6,000 per home for qualifying improvements
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Insulation, air sealing, HVAC upgrades, duct sealing, water heater replacement
state_rebate_programs.details: Program designed for low-income senior homeowners (62+) to improve home energy efficiency and reduce energy costs. Income qualification required.

state_rebate_programs.name: Weatherization Assistance Program
state_rebate_programs.amount: Average expenditure of approximately $7,500 per home
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Insulation, air sealing, heating/cooling system repair or replacement, windows, doors
state_rebate_programs.details: Federally funded program for income-qualifying households at or below 200% of federal poverty level.

programs.name: Residential Energy Efficiency Rebates
programs.amount: Up to $1,800 for heat pumps, $750 for smart thermostats and insulation, $50-$200 for ENERGY STAR appliances
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency HVAC systems, heat pumps, insulation, smart thermostats, ENERGY STAR windows, duct sealing

programs.name: Free Home Energy Assessment
programs.eligible_items: Comprehensive home energy evaluation with free installation of LEDs, smart power strips, and low-flow devices

programs.name: Solar Generations Rebate Program
programs.amount: Rebates vary; declining block structure as capacity is filled
